voice.text: We’ll start with the client middleware. It imports the middleware types from [Jitar](/dʒiːtɑr/), then defines a class implementing the middleware interface. The handle function receives the request object and the next handler. The request headers can be used to include authentication data. We’ll keep the example simple, but links to real implementations are in the video description. After adding the header, we call the next handler to execute the procedure, and finally export an instance of the middleware so [Jitar](/dʒiːtɑr/) can register it.
